article:
The Coronation of Charles III and Camilla was a ceremony held on May 6, 2023, at Westminster Abbey in London, marking the accession of Charles III to the British throne and the coronation of his wife, Camilla, as queen consort. The event was the 67th coronation in British history and the first to feature a woman as queen consort in over 900 years.

**Introduction**

The coronation was a highly anticipated event, with extensive preparations made by the British government, the Royal Family, and various organizations involved in the ceremony. The event was attended by thousands of guests from around the world, including heads of state, royalty, and other dignitaries. The coronation was also watched by millions of people on television and online, with many more following the event on social media.

**Preparation**

### Background

The coronation was planned for several years in advance, with the British government and the Royal Family working closely together to ensure a smooth and successful event. The ceremony was designed to reflect the traditions of the British monarchy while also incorporating modern elements and symbolism. The event was also seen as an opportunity to showcase British culture and values to a global audience.

### Service and Procession

The coronation service was conducted by the Archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby, and took place in Westminster Abbey, a historic church that has hosted coronations for centuries. The service involved a procession of the Royal Family, dignitaries, and other participants, as well as various ceremonies and rituals, including the anointing and crowning of the monarch.

### Guests

The guest list for the coronation was extensive, with over 2,000 people invited from around the world. The list included heads of state, royalty, and other dignitaries, as well as representatives from various organizations and institutions. The guest list was carefully curated to reflect the diversity and inclusivity of the modern British monarchy.

### Vestments and Crowns

The crown is set with over 3,000 precious stones, including the famous Cullinan II diamond. College GameDay (football TV program)

College GameDay is a live television program that airs on Saturdays during the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) football season. The program, which was first introduced in 1987, features analysis and discussion of the day's top college football games, as well as interviews with players, coaches, and other personalities from the sport. The show is broadcast on ESPN, and is one of the network's most popular programs.

Crew/Staff

### Current

The current on-air staff of College GameDay includes:

* Rece Davis, host
* Kirk Herbstreit, analyst
* Lee Corso, analyst
* Desmond Howard, analyst
* David Pollack, analyst
* Kirk Goldsberry, graphics and analysis
* Tom Rinaldi, sideline reporter
* Maria Taylor, sideline reporter

### Former

Former on-air staff members of College GameDay include:

* Chris Fowler, host (1987-2006)
* Lee Corso, analyst (1987-2006)
* Desmond Howard, analyst (1989-1993)
* David Pollack, analyst (2004-2006)
* Craig James, analyst (1987-1997)
* Jay Harris, analyst (1987-1997)
* Danny Kanell, analyst (2009-2014)
* Jesse Palmer, analyst (2005-2014)
* D.J. Dozier, analyst (2006-2007)
* Joey Galloway, analyst (2007-2009)

History

College GameDay was first introduced in 1987, and was originally broadcast on ESPN2. The program was created by Bill Rasmussen, and was designed to provide analysis and discussion of the day's top college football games. The show quickly gained popularity, and in 1993, it moved to ESPN's flagship network, where it has remained ever since.

In the early years of the program, the focus was on providing in-depth analysis of the top games of the week, as well as interviews with players, coaches, and other personalities from the sport. Over time, the program has evolved to include more features, such as live shots from the campuses of the teams playing, and interactive elements, such as live tweets and text messages from viewers.

### Power Four schools who have not yet hosted

Several Power Four schools have not yet hosted College GameDay on their campus. These schools include:

* University of Southern California (USC)
* University of Notre Dame
* Clemson University
* University of Washington

### Frequent matchups

Some of the most frequent matchups to be featured on College GameDay include:

* Alabama vs. Auburn (12 appearances)
* Florida vs. Florida State (11 appearances)
* Michigan vs. Ohio State (10 appearances)
* USC vs. UCLA (9 appearances)

* Tennessee vs. Alabama (7 appearances)

### AP Number 1 vs Number 2

College GameDay has featured several games between teams ranked number one and number two in the country. Some of the most notable examples include:

* 2001: USC vs. Oklahoma (Buckeyes win 14-0)
* 2004: Alabama vs. Auburn (Tigers win 28-18)
* 2008: Oklahoma vs. Texas (Sooners win 45-35)
* 2011: Alabama vs. LSU (Tigers win 9-6)

Celebrity guest pickers

Over the years, College GameDay has featured several celebrity guest pickers, including:

* Shaquille O'Neal
* Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson
* Snoop Dogg
* Jay Leno
* Jimmy Fallon
* Steve Harvey
* Tony Hawk
* Kevin Hart

International broadcasts

College GameDay is broadcast in over 200 countries and territories around the world, making it one of the most widely watched sports programs in the world.

article:
Anagyris foetida

Anagyris foetida, commonly known as the stinking anagyris or stinking galega, is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia.

**Distribution**

Anagyris foetida is found in the wild in countries including Algeria, Greece, Turkey, and Iran. It has been introduced to other regions, including parts of Europe and North America, where it can be found growing in disturbed areas, such as along roadsides and in abandoned fields.

**Habitat**

Anagyris foetida grows in a variety of habitats, including dry forests, scrublands, and rocky outcrops. It thrives in areas with full sun and well-drained soil.

**Adaptations to growth in Winter and early Spring**

Anagyris foetida has several adaptations that enable it to grow and thrive in the harsh conditions of winter and early spring.

### Summer leaf-fall

One of the unique features of Anagyris foetida is its ability to drop its leaves during the summer months. This process, known as summer leaf-fall, allows the plant to conserve water and energy during the hot and dry summer months. The leaves regrow in the fall, when the weather becomes cooler and more humid.

### Pollination by birds

Anagyris foetida is pollinated by birds, which visit the plant's flowers in search of nectar. The flowers are rich in nectar, and the plant's fragrance is attractive to birds. The seeds are also an important food source for birds, particularly during the fall and winter months.

**Seed dispersal**

Anagyris foetida has several mechanisms for seed dispersal, including soil seed banks and olive mimicry.

### Soil seed banks

One of the most important mechanisms for seed dispersal in Anagyris foetida is through soil seed banks. The seeds are able to survive in the soil for long periods of time, allowing the plant to colonize new areas and re-establish itself after disturbances.

### Olive mimicry

Anagyris foetida has a unique ability to mimic the appearance of an olive tree, allowing it to attract birds and other animals that are attracted to olives. The seeds are dispersed through the droppings of these animals, which can travel long distances and help to establish new populations of Anagyris foetida.

### Role of sheep

Sheep also play an important role in the dispersal of Anagyris foetida seeds. Sheep are attracted to the plant's leaves and flowers, and the seeds are dispersed through their droppings. This process is particularly important in areas where sheep are common, such as in parts of Europe and Asia.

### Other possible mammalian and avian vectors

Other possible vectors for seed dispersal in Anagyris foetida include rabbits, rodents, and other small mammals. These animals may ingest the seeds and then deposit them in new locations, helping to establish new populations of the plant.

### Unknown seed dispersal vector

Despite its importance in seed dispersal, the role of unknown vectors in Anagyris foetida is not well understood. Further research is needed to determine the extent to which unknown vectors contribute to seed dispersal in this plant.

### Tough, waterproof seed coats

The seeds of Anagyris foetida have tough, waterproof seed coats that help to protect them from the environment and allow them to survive for long periods of time. This adaptation is particularly important in areas where the plant is exposed to harsh weather conditions.

**Value as a nitrogen-fixing pioneer and companion plant**

Anagyris foetida is a nitrogen-fixing pioneer plant, meaning that it is able to fix atmospheric nitrogen into the soil in a form that is usable by other plants. This adaptation is particularly important in areas where the soil is poor in nutrients. Anagyris foetida also serves as a companion plant, providing shade and improving soil conditions for other plants.

**Medicinal use**

Anagyris foetida has been used in traditional medicine for a variety of purposes, including as a treatment for fever, rheumatism, and other conditions. The plant contains a number of bioactive compounds, including alkaloids and glycosides, which may contribute to its medicinal properties.

**Toxicity**

Anagyris foetida is toxic to humans and animals, and should be handled with caution. The plant contains a number of alkaloids, including anagyrine, which can cause a range of symptoms including nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.

### Alkaloid anagyrine a cause of birth defects

Anagyrine, one of the alkaloids present in Anagyris foetida, has been shown to be teratogenic, meaning that it can cause birth defects. This is a particular concern for pregnant women who may come into contact with the plant.

### Danger to children

Children are particularly vulnerable to the toxic effects of Anagyris foetida, and should be kept away from the plant at all times.

### Hazardous tainting of milk products

Anagyris foetida can also contaminate milk products, making them hazardous to consume.

### Case of accidental poisoning in Algeria

There have been reports of accidental poisoning in Algeria, where individuals have ingested Anagyris foetida leaves or seeds, leading to a range of symptoms including nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.

**Cultural references: Anagyris and Anagyrous**

Anagyris foetida has a number of cultural references, including the name Anagyris, which is derived from the Greek words "anagys" (meaning "to inflame") and "rys" (meaning "root").

### Lysistrata

Anagyris foetida is also mentioned in the ancient Greek play Lysistrata, where it is used as a metaphor for the conflict between men and women.

### Persistence of name

The name Anagyris has persisted over time, and is still used today to refer to the plant.

article:
OceanGate is a privately-owned company that specializes in the design, construction, and operation of manned submersibles for a variety of purposes, including tourism, research, and exploration. The company was founded in 2009 and has since become a leading player in the field of underwater exploration.

Background
----------

OceanGate's mission is to explore and preserve the world's oceans, with a focus on making the underwater world accessible to everyone. The company's vision is to create a fleet of state-of-the-art submersibles that can take people to the depths of the ocean, providing a unique and immersive experience.

History
-------

### 2009â2013: Founding and acquisition of Antipodes

OceanGate was founded in 2009 by Stockton Rush, a veteran of the US Navy and a pioneer in the field of underwater exploration. The company's first submersible, the Antipodes, was acquired from a previous owner and underwent a major overhaul to make it seaworthy. The Antipodes was a small, spherical submersible capable of reaching depths of up to 400 feet (122 meters).

During this period, Rush and his team began to develop a business plan for OceanGate, which would eventually become a leading player in the field of underwater exploration. The company's early years were marked by a series of test dives and demonstrations, which helped to establish OceanGate's reputation as a reliable and capable operator.

### 2013â2016: Construction of Cyclops and SÃ¶hnlein's departure

In 2013, OceanGate began construction on a new submersible, the Cyclops 1. The Cyclops 1 was a larger and more advanced submersible than the Antipodes, with a maximum depth rating of 1,000 feet (305 meters). The submersible was designed for research and exploration, and featured a range of advanced sensors and equipment.

During this period, OceanGate also began to expand its operations, with a series of dive trips to the Titanic wreck site. The company's first dive to the Titanic was in 2013, and was led by Stockton Rush himself.

### 2016â2023: Expansion of fleet and dives to the Titanic

In 2016, OceanGate began construction on a new submersible, the Titan. The Titan was a massive submersible, capable of reaching depths of up to 12,500 feet (3,810 meters). The submersible was designed for deep-sea exploration, and featured a range of advanced sensors and equipment.

During this period, OceanGate continued to expand its operations, with a series of dive trips to the Titanic wreck site. The company's dives to the Titanic were highly popular, and helped to establish OceanGate as a leading player in the field of underwater exploration.

### 2023: Implosion of Titan and death of Rush

On June 18, 2023, the Titan submersible imploded during a dive to the Titanic wreck site, resulting in the deaths of all five people on board, including Stockton Rush. The incident was widely reported in the media, and raised questions about the safety of underwater exploration.

Submersibles

### Antipodes

article:
**Elon Musk**

Elon Musk is a South African-born entrepreneur, inventor, and business magnate who has made significant contributions to the fields of technology, energy, transportation, and space exploration. He is the founder, CEO, and CTO of SpaceX, CEO and product architect of Tesla, Inc., and the founder of Neuralink and The Boring Company. Musk has become a prominent figure in the world of business and technology, known for his innovative ideas and ambitious goals.

**Early life and education**

### Childhood and family

Elon Musk was born on June 28, 1971, in Pretoria, South Africa. His parents, Maye Musk and Eric Musk, were both immigrants to South Africa. His father was an electrical engineer, and his mother was a model and dietitian. Musk has a younger brother, Kimbal Musk, and a younger sister, Tosca Musk. Musk was raised in a middle-class family and was an avid reader and programmer from an early age.

### Education

Musk moved to Canada in 1992 to attend college. He transferred to the University of Pennsylvania in 1994, where he graduated with a degree in economics and physics. During his time at college, Musk became interested in entrepreneurship and started his first company, Zip2, which provided online content publishing software for news organizations.

**Business career**

### Zip2

In 1995, Musk co-founded Zip2, a company that provided online content publishing software for news organizations. The company was acquired by Compaq in 1999 for $307 million. Musk made a significant profit from the sale of Zip2 and used the funds to invest in his next venture.

### X.com and PayPal

In 1999, Musk co-founded X.com, an online payment system that later became PayPal. In 2002, PayPal was acquired by eBay for $1.5 billion. Musk made a significant profit from the sale of PayPal and used the funds to invest in his next venture, SpaceX.

### SpaceX

**Starlink**

SpaceX is a private aerospace manufacturer and space transport services company founded in 2002 by Musk. The company is working towards establishing a human settlement on Mars and has developed several advanced technologies, including reusable rockets and satellite internet. Starlink is a satellite constellation project that aims to provide high-speed internet connectivity to remote and underserved areas of the world. The project consists of a network of thousands of small satellites that will be launched into low Earth orbit.

### Tesla

**SEC and shareholder lawsuits regarding tweets**

Tesla, Inc. is an American electric vehicle and clean energy company founded in 2003 by Musk. The company has become one of the leading manufacturers of electric vehicles and has disrupted the automotive industry with its innovative products and business model. However, Musk has been involved in several controversies, including a lawsuit filed by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regarding his tweets about taking Tesla private. Musk settled the lawsuit with the SEC in 2019, agreeing to pay a $20 million fine and have a Tesla lawyer review his tweets before they are posted.

**SolarCity and Tesla Energy**

Tesla acquired SolarCity, a solar panel manufacturer, in 2016. The acquisition marked a significant expansion of Tesla's presence in the renewable energy market. Tesla Energy is a division of Tesla that offers solar panel systems and energy storage products, including the Powerwall battery.

### Neuralink

Neuralink is a neurotechnology company founded in 2016 by Musk. The company is working on developing implantable brainâmachine interfaces (BMIs) that could potentially treat a wide range of medical conditions, including paralysis, depression, and anxiety.

### The Boring Company

The Boring Company is a tunnel construction company founded in 2016 by Musk. The company is working on developing advanced tunnel boring technologies that could potentially reduce the cost and time required to build tunnels.

### Twitter / X

Musk has been active on Twitter since 2009 and has used the platform to share his thoughts and ideas with his followers. In 2022, Musk acquired Twitter for $44 billion and rebranded the company as X.

### Leadership style

Musk is known for his demanding leadership style, which emphasizes innovation, hard work, and risk-taking. He has a reputation for pushing his employees to work long hours and take on high-risk projects. Musk's leadership style has been both praised and criticized, with some critics accusing him of being too demanding and others praising him for his ability to inspire innovation and creativity.

**Other activities**

### Musk Foundation

The Musk Foundation is a private foundation founded by Musk in 2002. The foundation supports a wide range of charitable causes, including education, healthcare, and environmental conservation.

### Hyperloop

The Hyperloop is a proposed high-speed transportation system that could potentially revolutionize the way people travel. Musk proposed the idea of the Hyperloop in 2013, and several companies have since been working on developing the technology.

### OpenAI and xAI

OpenAI is a non-profit artificial intelligence research organization founded in 2015 by Musk. The organization is working on developing advanced AI technologies that could potentially benefit humanity. xAI is a company founded by Musk that is working on developing advanced AI technologies.

### Tham Luang cave rescue and defamation case

In 2018, Musk faced a defamation lawsuit filed by Vernon Unsworth, a British cave explorer who was involved in the rescue of a Thai soccer team trapped in a cave. Musk had tweeted that Unsworth was a "pedo guy," which Unsworth claimed was a serious accusation. The lawsuit was settled out of court in 2019.

### 2018 cannabis incident

In 2018, Musk tweeted that he had smoked marijuana and that it was "sustainable." The tweet was widely criticized, and Musk later deleted it.

### Music

Musk is a music enthusiast and has been involved in several music-related projects. In 2018, he released a song called "Don't Doubt Harvester" with the musician Grimes.

### Private jet

Musk owns a private jet and has been known to use it to travel to his various business ventures.

### Company towns

Musk has been criticized for his plans to build company towns, including a proposed town in Texas that would be built by Musk's company, Boring Company.

**Wealth**

Musk's net worth is estimated to be over $200 billion, making him one of the richest people in the world.

**Personal actions, views, and social media usage**

### Finance

Musk has been involved in several high-profile financial transactions, including the acquisition of Twitter in 2022.

### Technology

Musk is a pioneer in the field of technology and has developed several innovative products and services, including the electric vehicle and the satellite internet system.

### Existential threats

Musk has spoken publicly about the existential threats posed by artificial intelligence and other technologies.

### Politics

### Conservative PAC activities

Musk has been involved in several conservative PAC activities, including a PAC called "Make America Great Again" that was founded by his friend, John Doolittle.

### International politics

Musk has been involved in several international politics, including a trip to Taiwan in 2022.

### Accusations of antisemitism

Musk has faced accusations of antisemitism for his tweets about the Jewish community.

### COVID-19

Musk has been involved in several efforts to combat COVID-19, including the development of a COVID-19 vaccine.

**Personal life**

### Relationships and children

Musk has been in several high-profile relationships, including with the musician Grimes. He has five children, including three sons and two daughters.

### Legal matters after 2020

Musk has been involved in several high-profile legal matters since 2020, including a defamation lawsuit filed by a Thai cave explorer.

**Public perception**

Musk has a mixed public perception, with some people viewing him as a visionary and others viewing him as a reckless and irresponsible leader.

**2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship**

The 2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship was the 19th edition of the FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship, the highest level international women's volleyball competition organized by FIVB. The tournament was held in Poland from September 23 to October 9, 2022.

**Host selection**

The host country was announced by FIVB on August 1, 2019. Poland was chosen as the host country after a bidding process, beating out other contenders. The tournament was held in four cities in Poland: Katowice, Warsaw, GdaÅsk, and ÅÃ³dÅº.

**Qualification**

The qualification process for the 2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship began in 2021 and concluded in 2022. A total of 24 teams qualified for the tournament, with 12 teams qualifying automatically as top 12 teams in the 2021 FIVB Women's Volleyball Nations League. The remaining 12 teams qualified through a series of regional qualification tournaments.

article:
**Russian Invasion of Ukraine**

The Russian invasion of Ukraine refers to the ongoing military conflict between Russia and Ukraine that began on 24 February 2022. The conflict has resulted in significant human suffering, economic losses, and a humanitarian crisis.

**Background**

### Post-Soviet Relations

Following the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, Ukraine and Russia established diplomatic relations. However, the two countries had differing views on several issues, including the status of Crimea and the Donbas region. Ukraine sought to maintain its independence and sovereignty, while Russia continued to exert influence over its former satellite states.

### Ukrainian Revolution, Russian Intervention in Crimea and Donbas

In 2014, Ukraine experienced a revolution that resulted in the ousting of President Viktor Yanukovych. Russia responded by annexing Crimea, a move that was widely condemned by the international community. In the Donbas region, Russian-backed separatists began to wage a guerrilla war against the Ukrainian government, leading to a protracted conflict that has resulted in thousands of deaths and widespread destruction.

**Prelude**

### Putin's Invasion Announcement

On 21 February 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a "special military operation" in Ukraine, marking the beginning of the invasion. In a televised address, Putin stated that the operation was necessary to protect Russian interests and to prevent Ukraine from becoming a part of NATO.

**Events**

### Initial Invasion (24 February â 7 April)

The initial invasion saw Russian forces making rapid gains in Ukraine, capturing key cities and infrastructure. The conflict quickly escalated, with both sides suffering significant losses.

#### Kyiv and Northern Front

Russian forces made a push towards Kyiv, Ukraine's capital city, but were eventually repelled by Ukrainian defenders. The city remained under Ukrainian control, but the surrounding region was heavily damaged.

#### Northeastern Front

In the northeastern part of the country, Russian forces captured the city of Kharkiv, but were eventually pushed back by Ukrainian counterattacks.

#### Southern Front

In the south, Russian forces captured the city of Mariupol, but were eventually besieged by Ukrainian forces.

#### Eastern Front

In the east, Russian forces made significant gains, capturing the city of Donetsk and pushing into the surrounding region.

### Southeastern Front (8 April â 5 September)

The southeastern front saw a prolonged and bloody conflict, with both sides suffering significant losses.

#### Fall of Mariupol

In May 2022, Russian forces captured Mariupol, after a prolonged siege that resulted in significant human suffering and destruction.

#### Fall of Sievierodonetsk and Lysychansk

In June 2022, Russian forces captured the cities of Sievierodonetsk and Lysychansk, marking a significant gain in the east.

#### Kharkiv Front

In the summer of 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack in the Kharkiv region, pushing Russian forces back and recapturing significant territory.

#### Kherson-Mykolaiv Front

In the south, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack in the Kherson-Mykolaiv region, pushing Russian forces back and recapturing significant territory.

#### Zaporizhzhia Front

In the south, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack in the Zaporizhzhia region, pushing Russian forces back and recapturing significant territory.

### Russian Annexations and Occupation Losses (6 September â 11 November 2022)

In September 2022, Russia annexed four Ukrainian regions: Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk, and Zaporizhzhia. However, the annexations were widely condemned by the international community, and Ukrainian forces continued to push back against Russian occupation.

### Zaporizhzhia Front

In the fall of 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack in the Zaporizhzhia region, pushing Russian forces back and recapturing significant territory.

### Kherson Counteroffensive

In the fall of 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack in the Kherson region, pushing Russian forces back and recapturing significant territory.

### Kharkiv Counteroffensive

In the fall of 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack in the Kharkiv region, pushing Russian forces back and recapturing significant territory.

### Winter Stalemate, Attrition Campaign and Military Surge (12 November 2022 â 7 June 2023)

The winter of 2022-2023 saw a stalemate in the conflict, with both sides suffering significant losses and neither able to gain a decisive advantage.

#### Battle of Bakhmut

In the spring of 2023, Russian forces launched a major attack on the city of Bakhmut, which was defended by Ukrainian forces.

### 2023 Counteroffensives and Summer Campaign (8 June 2023 â 1 December 2023)

In the summer of 2023, Ukrainian forces launched a series of counterattacks against Russian forces, pushing them back and recapturing significant territory.

### Russian Spring and Summer Campaigns and Ukrainian Incursion (1 December 2023 â present)

In the fall of 2023, Russian forces launched a series of attacks against Ukrainian forces, but were eventually pushed back by Ukrainian counterattacks.

#### Russian Offensive

In the fall of 2023, Russian forces launched a major attack against Ukrainian forces, but were eventually pushed back by Ukrainian counterattacks.

#### Ukrainian Offensive and Further Donbas Advances

In the fall of 2023, Ukrainian forces launched a series of counterattacks against Russian forces, pushing them back and recapturing significant territory.

**Battlespaces**

### Command

The conflict has seen a series of command changes on both sides, with Ukrainian forces being led by President Volodymyr Zelensky and Russian forces being led by President Vladimir Putin.

### Missile Attacks and Aerial Warfare

The conflict has seen a significant amount of missile attacks and aerial warfare, with both sides using a variety of missiles and aircraft to attack each other's forces.

#### Crimea Attacks

In the early stages of the conflict, Russian forces launched a series of missile attacks against Ukrainian forces in Crimea, but were eventually pushed back by Ukrainian defenders.

#### Russian Attacks Against Ukrainian Civilian Infrastructure

In the early stages of the conflict, Russian forces launched a series of attacks against Ukrainian civilian infrastructure, including power plants and water treatment facilities.

### Naval Blockade and Engagements

The conflict has seen a series of naval blockades and engagements, with both sides using their naval forces to attack each other's ships and ports.

### Nuclear Risk

The conflict has raised the risk of nuclear war, with both sides possessing nuclear weapons and a willingness to use them.

### Ukrainian Resistance

The conflict has seen a significant amount of Ukrainian resistance, with Ukrainian forces fighting back against Russian occupation and using guerrilla warfare tactics to attack Russian forces.

**International Aspects**

### Reactions

The conflict has seen a wide range of reactions from the international community, with many countries condemning Russia's actions and providing support to Ukraine.

### Foreign Involvement

**2023â24 Indian Super League**

The 2023â24 Indian Super League is the 10th season of the Indian Super League, the top division of Indian football. The season began on 7 October 2023 and is scheduled to conclude on 20 March 2024.

**Changes from last season**

The 2023â24 season saw significant changes from the previous season. The league format remained the same, with 11 teams competing in the regular season. However, the schedule was modified to accommodate the FIFA World Cup, with a longer break in November and December. Additionally, the league introduced a new rule allowing teams to make three foreign player signings, up from two in the previous season.

#Summary

The 2022â23 Premier League season was the first under the new format introduced by the Premier League, which included a new broadcasting deal and changes to the league's structure. The season saw significant developments, including managerial changes, player transfers, and a revamped fixture list. The league table saw several teams competing for the title, with Manchester City ultimately emerging as champions. The season also produced notable results, statistics, and awards.

This deal brought in significant revenue for the league and its clubs, and helped to increase the league's global reach. article:
India at the 2022 Commonwealth Games

The 2022 Commonwealth Games, officially known as the XXII Commonwealth Games, was an international multi-sport event held in Birmingham, England, from July 28 to August 8, 2022. India was one of the participating countries, with a contingent of athletes competing in various sports.

Withdrawal threat

Prior to the games, there was a threat of withdrawal by the Indian contingent over the issue of competition in the shooting events. However, the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) and the Indian government eventually reached an agreement with the Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF), allowing India to participate in the shooting events.

Competitors

India sent a total of 217 athletes to compete in 19 sports. The Indian team included athletes from various disciplines, including track and field, swimming, gymnastics, and wrestling.

Medals

India won a total of 22 medals at the 2022 Commonwealth Games, including 11 gold, 6 silver, and 5 bronze medals.

Medalists

The following Indian athletes won medals at the 2022 Commonwealth Games:

* Gold medalists:
	+ Neeraj Chopra (athletics)
	+ Bajrang Punia (wrestling)
	+ Sakshi Malik (wrestling)
	+ Saurabh Chaudhary (shooting)
	+ Anjum Moudgil (shooting)
	+ Manu Bhaker (shooting)
	+ Rashmi Ranjan Yadav (rowing)
	+ Rohan Bopanna and Ramkumar Ramanathan (tennis)
	+ PV Sindhu and Satwiksairaj Rankireddy (badminton)
* Silver medalists:
	+ Yogeshwar Dutt (wrestling)
	+ Sushila Devi Likmabam (wrestling)
	+ Manpreet Singh (hockey)
	+ Rupinder Pal Singh (hockey)
	+ Sanjay Kumar (athletics)
* Bronze medalists:
	+ Vikas Krishan Yadav (boxing)
	+ Manish Kaushik (boxing)
	+ Rohan Bopanna and Sania Mirza (tennis)
	+ Ankit Chhillar (wrestling)

Athletics

India won a total of 2 medals in the athletics events, including 1 gold and 1 silver medal.

* Neeraj Chopra won the gold medal in the men's javelin throw event with a distance of 88.39 meters.
* Sanjay Kumar won the silver medal in the men's 50 km walk event with a time of 3:51:28.

Badminton

India won a total of 2 medals in the badminton events, including 1 gold and 1 silver medal.

* PV Sindhu won the gold medal in the women's singles event, defeating her opponent in the final 21-15, 21-13.
* Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won the silver medal in the men's doubles event, losing to their opponents in the final 22-20, 21-18.

Boxing

India won a total of 2 medals in the boxing events, including 1 gold and 1 bronze medal.

* Vikas Krishan Yadav won the gold medal in the men's welterweight event, defeating his opponent in the final 5-0.
* Manish Kaushik won the bronze medal in the men's lightweight event, losing to his opponent in the semifinals 4-1.

Cricket

India won the gold medal in the cricket event, defeating Australia in the final 5-0.

Cycling

India won a total of 1 medal in the cycling events, including 1 bronze medal.

* Aryan Khari won the bronze medal in the men's omnium event, finishing with a total of 204 points.

Gymnastics

India won a total of 2 medals in the gymnastics events, including 1 bronze medal.

* Artistic:
	+ Pranati Nayak won the bronze medal in the women's floor exercise event, scoring a total of 12.533 points.
* Rhythmic:
	+ Kalpana Salim won the bronze medal in the women's group event, scoring a total of 23.300 points.

Hockey

India won a total of 2 medals in the hockey events, including 1 gold and 1 silver medal.

* Men's tournament:
	+ India won the gold medal, defeating Australia in the final 5-4 in a penalty shootout.
* Women's tournament:
	+ India won the silver medal, losing to Australia in the final 1-0.

Judo

India won a total of 1 medal in the judo events, including 1 bronze medal.

* Sushila Devi Likmabam won the bronze medal in the women's -52 kg event, losing to her opponent in the semifinals 100-000.

Lawn bowls

India won a total of 1 medal in the lawn bowls events, including 1 silver medal.

* Rhoda Thuku won the silver medal in the women's singles event, losing to her opponent in the final 9-6.

Para powerlifting

India won a total of 1 medal in the para powerlifting events, including 1 gold medal.

article:
**Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show**

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show was the halftime entertainment of Super Bowl LVII, the 57th edition of the National Football League (NFL) championship game, played on February 12, 2023, at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. The show was performed by multiple artists, including Rihanna.

**Background and Overview**

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show was produced by Roc Nation, a New York-based entertainment company co-founded by rapper Jay-Z. The show was directed by Hamish Hamilton, a British television director who has worked on several high-profile events, including the Grammy Awards and the Olympics. The halftime show was sponsored by Apple Music, which replaced Pepsi as the official beverage sponsor of the event.

The show was a highly anticipated event, with many fans and critics expecting a high-energy performance. The NFL had announced that the halftime show would feature a mix of music, dance, and visual effects, but the exact details of the performance remained a secret until the night of the event.

**Reception**

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising Rihanna's performance as a highlight of the event. The singer performed a mix of her hit songs, including "Bitch Better Have My Money," "Work," and "Where Have You Been," as well as a new single, "Lift Me Up." The performance also included a special appearance by Travis Scott, who joined Rihanna on stage for a rendition of "God's Plan."

Many critics praised Rihanna's performance, with Rolling Stone calling it "a triumphant return" and praising her "dazzling" vocals and "electrifying" stage presence. The New York Times praised the show's "high-energy" performance and Rihanna's ability to "command the stage." The show was also praised for its visually stunning production, with many noting the use of pyrotechnics, lasers, and drones to create a futuristic atmosphere.

**Select Critical Rankings for Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show**

* Rolling Stone: 4.5/5 stars
* The New York Times: 4/5 stars
* Billboard: 4/5 stars
* Variety: 4/5 stars
* Entertainment Weekly: 4/5 stars

**Awards and Nominations**

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show received several awards and nominations, including:

* **Emmy Award for Outstanding Variety Special (Live)**: The show was nominated for Outstanding Variety Special (Live) at the 74th Primetime Creative Arts Emmy Awards.
* **MTV Video Music Awards**: The show was nominated for Best Live Performance at the 2023 MTV Video Music Awards.

**Commercial Impact**

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show generated significant commercial interest, with many brands eager to advertise during the event. The show was broadcast in over 180 countries and territories, reaching a global audience of over 100 million viewers. The event generated an estimated $100 million in ad revenue, making it one of the most expensive advertising opportunities in the world.

**Set List**

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show set list included:

* "Bitch Better Have My Money"
* "Work"
* "Where Have You Been"

The show also featured several visual effects, including pyrotechnics, lasers, and drones, which were used to create a futuristic atmosphere. The show's production was highly praised by critics and fans alike, with many noting the high-energy performance and visually stunning production.

article:
**The Fabelmans**

The Fabelmans is a 2022 American coming-of-age drama film written and directed by Steven Spielberg. The film is a semi-autobiographical account of Spielberg's own childhood, drawing inspiration from his experiences growing up in the 1950s and 1960s in Phoenix, Arizona.

**Plot**

The film follows the story of Sammy Fabelman, a 12-year-old boy who is fascinated by filmmaking and the magic of the movies. As Sammy navigates his pre-teen years, he begins to explore the world of filmmaking, experimenting with his own short films and learning the art of storytelling from his family.

Through a series of vignettes and narrative threads, the film explores the Fabelman family's experiences, including their move to a new home, Sammy's relationship with his parents, and his struggles with adolescence. Along the way, Sammy becomes increasingly enthralled with filmmaking, using his passion to process the world around him and to cope with the challenges of growing up.

As the story unfolds, Sammy's filmmaking endeavors become more sophisticated, and he begins to explore the boundaries of storytelling, experimenting with different genres, techniques, and themes. Through his films, Sammy is able to express himself, explore his emotions, and connect with the world around him.

**Cast**

* Gabriel LaBelle as Sammy Fabelman
* Paul Dano as Mitzi Fabelman (Sammy's mother)
* Michelle Williams as Bessie Fabelman (Sammy's father)
* Seth Rogen as Boris Gelfand
* Julia Butters as Natalie Savage
* Oakes Fegley as Reggie
* Chloe East as Doris
* Robin Bartlett as Mitzi's mother
* Sadie Sink as Rachel
* Judd Hirsch as Uncle Boris

**Production**

### Development

The Fabelmans was first conceived by Steven Spielberg in the early 2020s, as a way to explore his own childhood and family history. Spielberg has stated that the film is a semi-autobiographical account of his own growing up, drawing inspiration from his experiences and relationships.

### Writing

The screenplay for The Fabelmans was written by Spielberg, who drew on his own experiences and emotions to create the story. Spielberg has stated that he wrote the screenplay over the course of several months, working closely with his collaborators to bring the story to life.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on The Fabelmans began in 2021, with Spielberg and his team beginning to assemble the cast and crew. The film was shot on location in Arizona and California, with a talented team of cinematographers, production designers, and visual effects artists working to bring the story to life.

### Casting

The cast of The Fabelmans includes a talented group of actors, including Gabriel LaBelle, Paul Dano, Michelle Williams, and Seth Rogen. LaBelle, who plays the lead role of Sammy Fabelman, was discovered by Spielberg through a series of auditions and casting sessions.

### Filming

Filming on The Fabelmans took place over several months in 2021 and 2022, with Spielberg working closely with his cast and crew to bring the story to life. Barry Humphries

Introduction
------------

Barry Humphries (1934-2021) was an Australian comedian, actor, and artist who is best known for his iconic characters, including Dame Edna Everage and Sir Les Patterson. With a career spanning over six decades, Humphries was a household name in Australia, the UK, and the United States, and was widely recognized for his unique brand of comedy and satire.

Early Life
----------

### Education

Humphries was born on February 17, 1934, in Melbourne, Australia, to Rosa and Leslie Humphries. He was the youngest of four children, and his family lived in a working-class neighborhood in the city. Humphries attended Brighton Grammar School, where he developed an interest in drama and the arts. He later enrolled at the University of Melbourne, where he studied law, but he dropped out after two years to pursue a career in comedy.

Career
-------

### Early career in Australia

Humphries began his career in comedy in the 1950s, performing in various stage shows and revues in Melbourne and Sydney. He quickly gained popularity for his unique style of comedy, which was characterized by his sharp wit, clever observations, and impressive impressions. In 1961, Humphries created his first iconic character, Sandy Stone, a working-class man from Melbourne who was known for his malapropisms and eccentricities.

### London and the 1960s

In 1960, Humphries moved to London, where he became a regular performer on the city's thriving comedy scene. He quickly gained a following among London's theatre crowd, and his characters, including Dame Edna Everage, began to gain popularity. Dame Edna was a housewife from Melbourne who was known for her outrageous behavior, sharp wit, and impressive fashion sense. The character was an instant hit, and Humphries went on to perform as Dame Edna in various stage shows and television appearances.

### 1970s

The 1970s were a pivotal decade for Humphries, as he continued to develop his characters and expand his audience. He performed as Dame Edna in various stage shows, including "The Dame Edna Experience" and "The Dame Edna Spectacle." He also appeared on television, including a popular series of one-off specials and a regular spot on the BBC's "The Two Ronnies." Humphries also began to experiment with other characters, including Sir Les Patterson, a boorish and sexist Australian diplomat who was a foil to Dame Edna.

### Film roles

Humphries made his film debut in 1963, starring in the Australian comedy "The Short and the Long of It." He went on to appear in a range of films, including "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972), "Barry McKenzie Holds His Own" (1974), and "The Great Muppet Caper" (1981). His most famous film role was as the voice of the villainous character, Verminous Skumm, in the animated film "The Muppet Christmas Carol" (1992).

### One-man shows

Humphries was known for his one-man shows, which were elaborate stage productions that showcased his characters and music. His most famous one-man show was "The Dame Edna Experience," which he performed in various cities around the world, including London, New York, and Melbourne. The show was a huge success, and Humphries went on to perform it numerous times throughout his career.

### Television roles

Humphries appeared in a range of television shows, including "The Two Ronnies," "Monty Python's Flying Circus," and "The Dame Edna Experience." He also had his own regular series, including "Dame Edna's Neighbourhood Watch" and "The Les Patterson Story." Humphries' television career spanned over three decades, during which he became a household name in the UK and the US.

### Success in the United States

In the 1970s and 1980s, Humphries became a regular performer on American television, including a series of one-off specials and a regular spot on the NBC network's "Saturday Night Live." He also appeared in various films, including "The Great Muppet Caper" (1981) and "Muppet Treasure Island" (1996). Humphries' success in the US was largely due to his popularity as Dame Edna, who became a beloved character among American audiences.

### Farewell tour

In 2012, Humphries embarked on a farewell tour, which took him to various cities around the world, including London, New York, and Melbourne. The tour, which was titled "Dame Edna: My Girl, My Mother, My Father, and Me," was a huge success, and Humphries went on to perform it numerous times throughout his career.

### Weimar Cabaret

In 2013, Humphries founded the Weimar Cabaret, a Melbourne-based cabaret club that showcased his characters and music. The club was a huge success, and Humphries went on to perform there numerous times throughout his career.

Characters
----------

### Dame Edna Everage

Dame Edna Everage is perhaps Humphries' most famous character. She is a housewife from Melbourne who is known for her outrageous behavior, sharp wit, and impressive fashion sense. Dame Edna was created in the 1960s, and has since become a beloved character around the world. Humphries has performed as Dame Edna in various stage shows and television appearances, and has also written several books about the character.

### Sir Les Patterson

Sir Les Patterson is another of Humphries' famous characters. He is a boorish and sexist Australian diplomat who is a foil to Dame Edna. Sir Les was created in the 1970s, and has since become a popular character in his own right. Humphries has performed as Sir Les in various stage shows and television appearances, and has also written several books about the character.

### Sandy Stone

Sandy Stone is a working-class man from Melbourne who was one of Humphries' earliest characters. He is known for his malapropisms and eccentricities, and was a regular performer on Humphries' early stage shows.

Personal Life
------------

### Views on transgenderism

Humphries was known for his support of the LGBTQ+ community, and was a vocal advocate for the rights of transgender individuals. He was a longtime friend and supporter of the Australian actress and drag queen, Julia Kristina, who was one of the first people to perform as a drag queen in Australia. Humphries also wrote several articles and essays about transgenderism, and was a vocal critic of the stigma and discrimination faced by transgender individuals.

### Death

Barry Humphries passed away on February 22, 2021, at the age of 87, after a long battle with dementia.

Other Work
----------

### Bibliography

Humphries wrote several books, including "The Dame Edna Experience" (1980), "The Dame Edna Spectacle" (1984), and "The Les Patterson Story" (1985).

### Filmography

Humphries appeared in numerous films, including "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972), "Barry McKenzie Holds His Own" (1974), "The Great Muppet Caper" (1981), and "Muppet Treasure Island" (1996).

### Fictional characters

------------------

article:
RRR is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language epic historical drama film written and directed by S. S. Rajamouli. The film is an original story set in the pre-independence era, blending elements of mythology, history, and social justice. It stars N. T. Rama Rao Jr., Ram Charan, Ajay Devgn, and Alia Bhatt in the lead roles.

**Introduction**

RRR is a monumental cinematic achievement that has left audiences and critics alike in awe. The film's unique blend of mythology, history, and social justice has sparked intense debate and conversation. With its stunning visuals, intricate plot, and outstanding performances, RRR has become a cultural phenomenon in India and beyond. This article provides an in-depth analysis of the film's plot, cast, production, themes, music, marketing, release, critical reception, box office, impact, accolades, adaptations, and future prospects.

**Plot**

The film is set in the 1920s, during the British Raj era, and follows the story of two milkmen, Komaram Bheem (played by N. T. Rama Rao Jr.) and Alluri Sitarama Raju (played by Ram Charan). Bheem is a tribal warrior who seeks to avenge the death of his family, while Raju is a revolutionary who fights against the British colonial rule. The two men meet and team up to fight against the British, leading to a series of intense battles and confrontations.

Throughout the film, Rajamouli weaves a complex narrative that blends elements of mythology, history, and social justice. The story is driven by the characters' struggles against the oppressive British rule, and their efforts to unite the people against a common enemy. The film's climax features an epic battle between the Indian revolutionaries and the British forces, resulting in a dramatic and emotional conclusion.

**Cast**

The film features an ensemble cast, including:

* N. T. Rama Rao Jr. as Komaram Bheem
* Ram Charan as Alluri Sitarama Raju
* Ajay Devgn as Scott B. Amery (a British officer)
* Alia Bhatt as Sita (the wife of Bheem)
* Olivia Morris as Jenny (a British woman who falls in love with Raju)
* Ray Stevenson as Colonel Cunningham (a British officer)
* Alison Doody as Catherine Tresa (a British woman who helps the Indian revolutionaries)

**Production**

### Development

The development of RRR began in 2015, when Rajamouli started working on the script. He drew inspiration from the lives of Komaram Bheem and Alluri Sitarama Raju, two Indian revolutionaries who fought against the British colonial rule. Rajamouli wanted to create a film that would showcase the courage and sacrifices of these men, and their efforts to unite the people against a common enemy.

### Casting

The casting process for RRR was a long and intricate one. Rajamouli held auditions for the lead roles, and eventually selected N. T. Rama Rao Jr. and Ram Charan for the parts of Bheem and Raju. The two actors underwent extensive training to prepare for their roles, including learning martial arts and horse riding.

### Design

The film's design was a crucial aspect of its production. Rajamouli worked with a team of designers to create the film's iconic costumes, sets, and visual effects. The film's cinematography was handled by K. K. Senthil Kumar, who used a combination of traditional and digital techniques to capture the film's stunning visuals.

### Principal Photography

Principal photography for RRR began in 2018 and lasted for over two years. The film was shot on location in India and abroad, including in the states of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. The film's production was plagued by several delays, including a four-month hiatus due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

### Post-production

The post-production process for RRR was a lengthy and complex one. Rajamouli worked with a team of editors to assemble the film's final cut, which was then mixed and mastered by a team of sound engineers. The film's visual effects were created by a team of VFX artists, who worked tirelessly to bring the film's epic battles and dramatic sequences to life.

Leonardo Torres Quevedo

Leonardo Torres Quevedo (November 2, 1852 â December 18, 1936) was a Spanish engineer and mathematician who made significant contributions to the fields of electrical engineering, mechanics, and computer science. He is best known for his work on cableways, analogue calculating machines, and the development of the first digital computer.

**Early life and education**

Torres Quevedo was born in Madrid, Spain, to a family of Spanish nobility. His father, JosÃ© Torres Quevedo, was a physician, and his mother, MarÃ­a JosÃ© de Quevedo, was a member of the Spanish aristocracy. Torres Quevedo showed a keen interest in science and mathematics from an early age and was largely self-taught. He studied mathematics and physics at the Universidad Central de Madrid, where he graduated with a degree in engineering in 1874.

**Career**

Torres Quevedo began his career as an engineer with the Spanish government, working on various projects related to transportation and infrastructure. In the 1880s, he became interested in the field of electrical engineering and began to develop new technologies related to electrical power transmission and distribution.

In the late 1880s, Torres Quevedo began working on the development of cableways, which were systems for transporting people and goods using pulleys and cables. He designed and built several cableway systems in Spain and abroad, including a cableway system for the 1889 World's Fair in Paris. His work on cableways led to the development of new technologies related to traction and mechanical engineering.

### Analogue calculating machines

In the early 1900s, Torres Quevedo began working on the development of analogue calculating machines, which were devices that used mechanical or electrical systems to perform mathematical calculations. He designed and built several analogue calculating machines, including the first mechanical calculator that could perform multiplication and division operations.

### Aerostatics

Torres Quevedo was also interested in the field of aerostatics, which is the study of the behavior of gases in relation to the weight of air. He conducted research on the aerodynamics of airships and developed new technologies related to airship design and construction.

### Radio control: the Telekino

In the 1920s, Torres Quevedo began working on the development of radio-controlled devices, including the Telekino, which was a radio-controlled boat that could be operated from shore. The Telekino was a pioneering achievement in the field of remote control technology and paved the way for the development of modern remote control systems.

In the 1920s, Torres Quevedo built a chess automaton called El Ajedrecista, which was a machine that could play chess against humans. El Ajedrecista was a pioneering achievement in the field of artificial intelligence and was one of the first machines capable of playing a complex game like chess.

Torres Quevedo wrote several essays on the topic of automatics, which was a field of study that dealt with the design and operation of machines and systems that could perform tasks automatically. Torres Quevedo also worked on the development of analytical machines, which were devices that used mathematical algorithms to solve problems and perform calculations. His work on analytical machines led to the development of new technologies related to computer science and artificial intelligence.

In the 1910s and 1920s, Torres Quevedo worked on several naval projects, including the design and construction of submarines and other naval vessels. His work on naval projects led to the development of new technologies related to ship design and construction.

article:
**Eiji Tsuburaya**

Eiji Tsuburaya was a renowned Japanese film director, special effects director, and producer, best known for his work on Godzilla and other classic kaiju films. Born on January 7, 1901, in Tokyo, Japan, Tsuburaya's life was marked by a long and distinguished career in the film industry, spanning over four decades.

**Introduction**

Eiji Tsuburaya's legacy is deeply rooted in the world of Japanese cinema, particularly in the realm of science fiction and fantasy. As the mastermind behind some of the most iconic films of the 20th century, Tsuburaya's contributions to the genre have had a lasting impact on popular culture. From his early days as a special effects artist to his rise as a director and producer, Tsuburaya's work continues to captivate audiences worldwide.

**Childhood to War Years: 1901â1945**

### Childhood and Youth (1901â1919)

Tsuburaya was born into a family of modest means, with his father working as a merchant. Growing up in a traditional Japanese household, Tsuburaya was exposed to various forms of art and entertainment from an early age. He developed a passion for photography and filmmaking, which would eventually become the driving force behind his career. As a young boy, Tsuburaya would often sneak into movie theaters to watch films, which further fueled his interest in the medium.

### Early Career and Marriage (1919â1934)

After completing his education, Tsuburaya began working as a special effects artist for the Nikkatsu film studio. In 1926, he married his wife, Tsuneko, who would become a significant support system throughout his career. During this period, Tsuburaya worked on various films, honing his skills and developing his expertise in special effects.

### J.O. Studios, Directorial Works, and Toho (1934â1940)

In 1934, Tsuburaya joined the J.O. Studios, where he began working as a director and special effects director. His first major film, _The Tale of the White Serpent_ (1933), marked the beginning of his directorial career. Tsuburaya's work during this period was heavily influenced by Western cinema, particularly the works of Fritz Lang and D.W. Griffith. In 1937, he joined the Toho film studio, where he would go on to work on some of his most iconic films.

### War Years (1941â1945)

During World War II, Tsuburaya's work became increasingly focused on propaganda films and documentaries. He worked on various productions, including the 1943 film _A Japanese Tragedy_, which was later criticized for its perceived pro-war stance. Tsuburaya's experiences during this period would have a lasting impact on his future work, particularly in his later films, which often dealt with themes of war and its consequences.

**Occupation Years to ChÅ«shingura: 1946â1962**

### Early Postwar Work (1946â1954)

After the war, Tsuburaya returned to Toho, where he worked on a series of films, including _The Secret of the Telegian_ (1952) and _Rodan_ (1956). During this period, Tsuburaya's work became increasingly focused on science fiction and fantasy, which would eventually become his signature genre.

### International Recognition (1954â1959)

Tsuburaya's international recognition began in the mid-1950s, with the release of _Rodan_ and _The Mysterians_ (1957). His films were met with critical acclaim, particularly in the United States, where they were released as part of the "Science Fiction Triple Features" series. Tsuburaya's work during this period was heavily influenced by American cinema, particularly the works of Stanley Kubrick and Alfred Hitchcock.

### From The Secret of the Telegian to ChÅ«shingura (1960â1962)

In the early 1960s, Tsuburaya's work became increasingly focused on historical dramas, particularly the 1962 film _ChÅ«shingura_. This period marked a significant shift in Tsuburaya's career, as he began to explore more mature and complex themes in his films.

**Birth of a Company to Last Years: 1963â1970**

### Birth of a Company and Career Expansion (1963â1964)

In 1963, Tsuburaya founded his own production company, Tsuburaya Productions. This marked a new chapter in his career, as he began to produce and direct films on a larger scale. During this period, Tsuburaya worked on various projects, including the 1964 film _Ultraman_, which would go on to become a cultural phenomenon in Japan.

### Japanese-American Coproductions and Ultra Q (1964â1965)

Tsuburaya's partnership with American producer, Tomoyuki Tanaka, resulted in the 1964 film _Ultraman_. This marked the beginning of a successful coproduction series, which included the 1964 film _Ultra Seven_ and the 1965 series _Ultra Q_. Tsuburaya's work during this period was heavily influenced by American television, particularly the works of Irwin Allen and Rod Serling.

### Ultraman and Beyond (1966â1967)

In 1966, Tsuburaya released the film _Ultraman: The Next Generation_, which marked a new direction in the franchise. During this period, Tsuburaya continued to work on various projects, including the 1967 film _Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster_, which was released as part of the Godzilla franchise.

### Final Works, Last Years, and Death (1968â1970)

Tsuburaya's final film, _Ultraman: The Next Generation 2_, was released in 1968. He continued to work on various projects, including the 1969 film _Terror Beyond War_. Tsuburaya passed away on January 25, 1970, at the age of 69, leaving behind a legacy of iconic films and a lasting impact on popular culture.

**Filmmaking**

### Style, Themes, and Techniques

Tsuburaya's filmmaking style was characterized by his use of special effects, which often blended traditional techniques with modern technology. His films often dealt with themes of science fiction, fantasy, and historical drama, which were influenced by his interests in Western cinema and Japanese culture.

### Relationship with Cast and Crew

Tsuburaya was known for his collaborative approach to filmmaking, often working closely with his cast and crew to develop his ideas. He was particularly close to his lead actors, including Akira Takarada and Yuriko Hoshi, who appeared in many of his films.

### Production and Editing

Tsuburaya's productions were often marked by their efficient and streamlined approach, which allowed him to complete films on a tight budget. His editing style was characterized by his use of fast-paced cuts and elaborate special effects.

**Legacy**

### Cultural Impact

Tsuburaya's work had a lasting impact on popular culture, particularly in Japan, where his films remain iconic and influential to this day. His legacy extends beyond the film industry, as his work has inspired countless artists, writers, and filmmakers.

### Tributes

Tsuburaya has been the subject of numerous tributes and retrospectives, including the 2003 documentary _The Birth of Ultra Q_ and the 2013 book _Eiji Tsuburaya: The Master of Monsters_. His legacy continues to be celebrated through various events and exhibitions, including the 2019 Eiji Tsuburaya Festival in Tokyo.

### Portrayals

Tsuburaya has been portrayed by various actors, including Takashi Noguchi, who appeared in the 2019 film _The Great War of the Izu Peninsula_. His life and work continue to be the subject of various adaptations and interpretations, including the 2020 manga series _Eiji Tsuburaya: The Master of Monsters_.

**Selected Filmography**

* _Rodan_ (1956)
* _The Mysterians_ (1957)
* _Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster_ (1964)
* _Ultraman: The Next Generation_ (1966)
* _Ultraman: The Next Generation 2_ (1968)
* _Terror Beyond War_ (1969)

### Television

* _Ultra Q_ (1966)
* _Ultra Seven_ (1967)

**Awards and Honors**

Tsuburaya received numerous awards and honors throughout his career, including the 1964 Blue Ribbon Award for Best Director and the 1966 Kinema Junpo Award for Best Director. His legacy continues to be celebrated through various awards and tributes, including the 2019 Eiji Tsuburaya Award for Excellence in Film.

**Notes**

Tsuburaya's life and work continue to be the subject of ongoing research and analysis. His legacy extends beyond the film industry, as his work has inspired countless artists, writers, and filmmakers. This article provides a comprehensive overview of his life and work, highlighting his significant contributions to the world of Japanese cinema.

St. Michael's Golden-Domed Monastery

St. Michael's Golden-Domed Monastery is a functioning monastery and the main cathedral of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate) located in Kiev, Ukraine. The monastery complex is situated on a hill overlooking the Dnieper River and is one of the most iconic landmarks in Kiev.

## History

### Early years

The history of St. Michael's Monastery dates back to the 12th century when it was founded by Prince Yaroslav Osmomysl in 1108. At that time, it was a small wooden church dedicated to St. Michael. Over the centuries, the monastery underwent several transformations, with the first stone church being built in the 12th century.

**EuroBasket Women 2023**

The EuroBasket Women 2023 was the 42nd edition of the European women's basketball championship, which took place from June 15 to June 25, 2023, in several cities across Slovenia and Israel. **Bidding process**

article:
Embassy without a Government

An embassy without a government is a unique situation where a country's diplomatic mission continues to operate despite the collapse or dissolution of the host country's government. This phenomenon has occurred in various parts of the world, often due to civil wars, revolutions, or other forms of political upheaval. In such cases, the embassy's continued presence can serve as a symbol of stability and a connection to the international community.

History

### Russia (1917â1925)

Following the Russian Revolution of 1917, the newly established Soviet government began to dissolve the Russian Empire's diplomatic missions. However, the Soviet government established its own diplomatic corps, which continued to operate in various countries. In some cases, the Soviet missions were able to maintain their presence in countries where the old Russian Empire's diplomatic corps had previously operated.

#### Diplomatic missions after 1917

After the Russian Revolution, many countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and France, withdrew their diplomatic missions from Russia or severely reduced their presence. However, the Soviet government was able to establish new diplomatic missions in these countries, which continued to operate despite the collapse of the Russian Empire.

One notable example is the Soviet embassy in Washington, D.C., which was established in 1933. The embassy played a crucial role in promoting Soviet interests in the United States and served as a symbol of Soviet diplomacy during the interwar period.

#### Dissolution of the Soviet Union

In 1991, the Soviet Union dissolved, and Russia became an independent country. The Russian government inherited the Soviet Union's diplomatic corps and continued to operate many of the Soviet embassies and consulates. However, some countries, such as the United States, reduced their diplomatic presence in Russia following the dissolution of the Soviet Union.

### Spain (1939â1977)

During the Spanish Civil War, the Republican government's diplomatic missions were severely limited, and many countries withdrew their recognition of the Republican government. However, the Spanish Republic continued to maintain diplomatic relations with some countries, including the Soviet Union and Mexico.

#### Diplomatic missions after 1939

After the Nationalist victory in the Spanish Civil War, the new Spanish government, led by General Francisco Franco, established its own diplomatic corps. However, many countries, including the United States and the United Kingdom, reduced their diplomatic presence in Spain or withdrew their recognition of the Franco regime.

Despite this, the Spanish embassy in Washington, D.C. continued to operate, and the Spanish government maintained diplomatic relations with some countries. However, the Spanish embassy was severely limited in its activities, and many countries did not recognize the Franco regime.

### Poland (1939â1990)

During World War II, Poland was occupied by Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union. The Polish government-in-exile continued to operate in London, and the Polish embassy there served as a symbol of Polish resistance against the Nazi and Soviet occupations.

#### Diplomatic missions after 1939

After the war, Poland became a Soviet satellite state, and the communist government established its own diplomatic corps. However, many countries, including the United States, reduced their diplomatic presence in Poland or withdrew their recognition of the communist government.

Despite this, the Polish embassy in Washington, D.C. continued to operate, and the Polish government maintained diplomatic relations with some countries. However, the Polish embassy was severely limited in its activities, and many countries did not recognize the communist government.

### Afghanistan (2021âpresent)

In 2021, the Taliban seized power in Afghanistan, and the country's government was dissolved. The United States and other countries withdrew their diplomatic missions from Afghanistan, and the country's embassy in Washington, D.C. was closed.

However, the Afghan embassy in Washington, D.C. was reopened in 2022, and the Afghan government began to establish diplomatic relations with some countries. The embassy serves as a symbol of Afghan diplomacy and a connection to the international community.

See also

* Diplomatic missions
* Embassies
* Governments in exile
* International relations

Notes

* This article does not include a comprehensive list of all embassies without governments. It focuses on notable examples of countries where embassies continued to operate despite the collapse or dissolution of the host country's government.

article:
The 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup was the 23rd edition of the FIFA U-20 World Cup, the biennial international youth football tournament contested by national teams of players under the age of 20 organized by FIFA. The tournament was held in Indonesia from May 20 to June 11, 2023.

**Host selection**
The host selection process for the 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup began in 2019, with FIFA announcing that it would be held in a single country. Indonesia was awarded the hosting rights for the tournament on November 16, 2022, by the FIFA Council. This marked the country's first time hosting a FIFA U-20 World Cup.

**Qualified teams**
A total of 24 teams qualified for the 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup, with five teams qualifying through the UEFA qualification tournament, four teams through the CONMEBOL qualification tournament, four teams through the CAF qualification tournament, four teams through the AFC qualification tournament, four teams through the CONCACAF qualification tournament, and three teams through the OFC qualification tournament.

The qualified teams were:

**Background and Naming**

The naming of windstorms in Europe follows a specific convention, which involves categorizing storms into different groups based on their severity and impact. The naming convention is as follows:

### Definitions and Naming Conventions

The naming of windstorms in Europe is based on a system developed by the European Windstorm Barometer, which categorizes storms into five categories: Low, Moderate, High, Severe, and Extremely Severe. The naming convention used in the 2022â23 European windstorm season is as follows:

* Low: Storms with wind speeds of up to 80 km/h (50 mph)
* Moderate: Storms with wind speeds of 80-100 km/h (50-62 mph)
* High: Storms with wind speeds of 100-120 km/h (62-75 mph)
* Severe: Storms with wind speeds of 120-140 km/h (75-87 mph)
* Extremely Severe: Storms with wind speeds of 140 km/h or higher (87 mph or higher)

**2022â23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season**

The 2022â23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season was a period of the year when tropical cyclones formed in the South-West Indian Ocean. The season officially began on July 1, 2022, and ended on June 30, 2023. The South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season is an area north of 10Â°S and east of 45Â°E.

**Seasonal forecasts**

The Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) Climate Prediction and Applications Centre (ICPAC) issued its seasonal forecast for the 2022â23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season in June 2022. The forecast predicted a 60% chance of above-average cyclone activity, with 12â15 named storms expected.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) also issued a seasonal forecast in June 2022, predicting a 50% chance of above-average cyclone activity in the South-West Indian Ocean. The IMD forecast predicted 10â13 named storms.

The Fiji Meteorological Service (FMS) issued a seasonal forecast in June 2022, predicting a 40% chance of above-average cyclone activity in the South-West Indian Ocean. The FMS forecast predicted 8â10 named storms.

**Seasonal summary**

The 2022â23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season was a below-average season, with 11 named storms forming. The season began on August 12, 2022, with the formation of Tropical Storm Ashley. The season ended on May 15, 2023, with the dissipation of Tropical Storm 09.

The season was marked by a below-average number of intense tropical cyclones, with only three very intense tropical cyclones forming. However, the season was not without its intense storms, with Cyclone Freddy and Cyclone Darian both causing significant damage and loss of life.

**Systems**

#### **Moderate Tropical Storm Ashley**

Tropical Storm Ashley formed on August 12, 2022, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 50 mph and was located at a latitude of 20Â°S and a longitude of 65Â°E. The storm moved southwards and dissipated on August 17, 2022.

Tropical Storm Balita formed on September 10, 2022, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 50 mph and was located at a latitude of 15Â°S and a longitude of 55Â°E. The storm moved westwards and dissipated on September 15, 2022.

#### **Tropical Depression 03**

Tropical Depression 03 formed on October 10, 2022, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 25 mph and was located at a latitude of 10Â°S and a longitude of 45Â°E. The storm moved eastwards and dissipated on October 12, 2022.

#### **Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Darian**

Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Darian formed on November 10, 2022, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 160 mph and was located at a latitude of 20Â°S and a longitude of 60Â°E. The storm moved southwards and dissipated on November 20, 2022.

#### **Tropical Cyclone Cheneso**

Tropical Cyclone Cheneso formed on December 12, 2022, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 70 mph and was located at a latitude of 15Â°S and a longitude of 50Â°E. The storm moved westwards and dissipated on December 18, 2022.

#### **Tropical Cyclone Dingani**

Tropical Cyclone Dingani formed on January 10, 2023, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 60 mph and was located at a latitude of 10Â°S and a longitude of 40Â°E. The storm moved eastwards and dissipated on January 15, 2023.

#### **Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Freddy**

Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Freddy formed on February 10, 2023, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 150 mph and was located at a latitude of 20Â°S and a longitude of 55Â°E. The storm moved southwards and dissipated on February 20, 2023.

#### **Tropical Cyclone Enala**

Tropical Cyclone Enala formed on March 12, 2023, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 60 mph and was located at a latitude of 15Â°S and a longitude of 45Â°E. The storm moved westwards and dissipated on March 18, 2023.

#### **Moderate Tropical Storm 09**

Moderate Tropical Storm 09 formed on May 10, 2023, in the South-West Indian Ocean. The storm had maximum sustained winds of 50 mph and was located at a latitude of 10Â°S and a longitude of 35Â°E. The storm moved eastwards and dissipated on May 15, 2023.

#### **Intense Tropical Cyclone Fabien**
